intro: Siphocampylus brevicalyx, commonly known as the broad-leaved siphocampylus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded habitats and has a short life cycle, often completing its development in a single growing season. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
